title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" includes definitions. Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include changes related to family farms, security interests, and definitions. The amendments to Section 101 of title 11, United States Code include changes related to family farms, security interests, and definitions. These changes involve renumbering paragraphs, inserting terms, and adjusting punctuation in various paragraphs. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Amends Section 104 of title 11, United States Code by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Amends Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''. SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Amends Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''. SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Section 327 of title 11, United States Code is amended to update the authority of the Trustee, including changes in subsections (b), (c), and (d). Section 328(b) is also amended to limit compensation by removing the ability to serve as an attorney or accountant. Section 328(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to limit compensation by replacing references to attorneys or accountants with professional persons who render such services. Section 328(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to limit compensation by replacing references to attorneys or accountants with professional persons who render such services, specifying the qualifications of the professional person. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code to include compensation on a fixed or percentage fee basis.

SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code to adjust compensation for officers and attorneys.

SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code to remove certain tax provisions.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to remove certain tax provisions. SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to clarify the effect of conversion. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by removing certain tax provisions. Section 348(f)(2) is amended to clarify the effect of conversion. Section 362 of title 11, United States Code, is amended regarding the automatic stay. SEC. 11. EXECUTORY CONTRACTS AND UNEXPIRED LEASES. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions regarding the satisfaction of penalty rates and nonmonetary obligations in executory contracts and unexpired leases. The amendments to Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, include provisions for the satisfaction of penalty rates and nonmonetary obligations in executory contracts and unexpired leases. This involves addressing default arising from failure to perform nonmonetary obligations under such contracts or leases. Subsection (c) is modified by adding an "or" in paragraph (2), inserting a period in paragraph (3), and striking paragraph (4). Subsection (d) is amended by striking paragraphs (5) through (9). In subsection (c), amendments include adding "or" in paragraph (2), inserting a period in paragraph (3), and striking paragraph (4). Subsection (d) is amended by striking paragraphs (5) through (9). Additionally, subsection (f)(1) is modified by removing "; except that" and everything following it, and inserting a period. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS. Amends the item relating to section 556 regarding contractual rights. SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Amends section 503(b)(4) by inserting references before paragraph (3). SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Section 522 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to clarify liabilities and support. SEC. 16. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. The amendments involve transferring paragraphs, redesignating subsections, and making specific changes to subsection (a)(17) regarding prisoners and section 1915. In subsection (a)(17), changes are made to specify that actions are taken on a prisoner by a Federal court. Subsection (e) is amended to correct a grammatical error by changing "a insured" to "an insured". SEC. 17. Amendment to Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, US Code regarding discharge effects. SEC. 18. Amendment to Section 525(c) of title 11, US Code for protection against discriminatory treatment. SEC. 19. Property of the estate. Section 525(c) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include protections for student grants and any program operated under part B, D, or E. Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) is also amended to include "365 or" before "542". Additionally, Section 546 is amended by redesignating subsection (g) as subsection (h). SEC. 19. PROPERTY OF THE ESTATE amended to include "365 or" before "542". SEC. 20. LIMITATIONS ON AVOIDING POWERS redesignates subsection (g) as subsection (h). SEC. 21. LIABILITY OF TRANSFEREE OF AVOIDED TRANSFER. Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to clarify the conditions under which a transfer can be avoided or recovered under section 547. Section 547 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to allow the avoidance or recovery of transfers made for the benefit of a transferee who was not an insider at the time of the transfer. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 547(b) to include reference to section 550(c) for clarification. SEC. 22. SETOFF. Amends Section 553(b)(1) of title 11, United States Code by changing the reference from "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)". SEC. 23. DISPOSITION OF PROPERTY OF THE ESTATE. Amends Section 726(b) of title 11, United States Code by removing "1009,". SEC. 24. GENERAL PROVISIONS. Amends Section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b),". SEC. 25. APPOINTMENT OF ELECTED TRUSTEE. Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions for the election of an eligible, disinterested trustee at a meeting of creditors. The United States trustee must file a report certifying the election, after which the elected trustee is considered appointed for the section's purposes, and the service of any trustee appointed under subsection (d) will end. The trustee elected at a meeting of creditors must file a report certifying the election. Once filed, the elected trustee is considered appointed for the section's purposes, and the service of any trustee appointed under subsection (d) will end. In case of disputes, the court will resolve them. SEC. 26. ABANDONMENT OF RAILROAD LINE.

Section 1170(e)(1) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``section 11347'' and inserting ``section 11326(a)''.

SEC. 27. CONTENTS OF PLAN.

Section 1172(c)(1) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``section 11347'' and inserting ``section 11326(a)''.

SEC. 28. PAYMENTS.

Section 1226(b)(2) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``1202(c) of this title'' and inserting ``586(b) of title 28'', and by striking ``1202(d) of this title'' and inserting ``586(e)(1)(B) of title 28''.

SEC. 29. DISCHARGE. SEC. 28. PAYMENTS.

Amends Section 1226(b)(2) of title 11, United States Code by replacing references to "1202(c)" with "586(b)" and "1202(d)" with "586(e)(1)(B)".

SEC. 29. DISCHARGE.

Amends Section 1228 of title 11, United States Code by replacing "1222(b)(10)" with "1222(b)(9)".

SEC. 30. CONTENTS OF PLAN. SEC. 31. DISCHARGE. Amends Section 1228 of title 11, United States Code by replacing "1222(b)(10)" with "1222(b)(9)". Section 1322 of title 11, United States Code is amended to change subsection (b) to subsection (d) and to remove a comma in subsection (e). Section 1328(a) is also amended to specify certain types of debts that are not discharged under bankruptcy law. SEC. 32. Amendment to title 28, United States Code regarding bankruptcy cases and proceedings. SEC. 33. Amendment to the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 regarding the Bankruptcy Review Commission. SEC. 34. Knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 34. Knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. Section 156(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to clarify terms related to bankruptcy and documents. SEC. 35. Effective Date; Application of Amendments. This Act and its amendments will take effect upon enactment, applying only to cases initiated under title 11 of the United States Code after the enactment date.
